course.title: Unreal Engine 4 Mastery: Create Multiplayer Games with C++
course.subtitle: Unleash the power of C++ and Blueprint to develop Multiplayer Games with AI in this Epic Games-approved course.

reviews.body: Great course. goes by fast, a few bugs but all are easily solved in the comments of each lecture and are due to changes in unreal engine since the course was created. Tom is a great teacher. He's very fast and covers a ton of topics.
Excellent course, a lot of info very compacted and ready to serve. Very useful to people who wants to learn UE and only knows the basics like me.

Good course. Learned a decent amount about unreal and programming for unreal, but I would've liked to see more information for multiplayer functionality as this is labeled a "Mastery" course. Other than that some of the info was outdated and had to look into the Q&A for some fixes.

Pretty good but it's starting to get a little dated. I had to look up some new best practices but honestly anyone who had a little programing experience (as you would expect with someone choosing to use c++) could easily troubleshoot.

Great Course. I am still learning but this course definitely helped me in my journey to becoming a Game Developer. Highly recommend the course and hope Tom will create more content and courses in the future!

He basically just code without showing a roadmap of what he intends to code and explain the logic behind it. Also here and there I ran into problems with compiling, which I couldn't solve and couldn't find any solution online. Maybe this was working a while back but not anymore.
Tom is really a good teacher, everything he taught in this course is quite helpful to understand Unreal Engine and i am glad that i took this course.
Многие аспекты требуют раскрытого пояснения на примерах. Очень нахватает этого. Иногда автор мешает с++ и blueprints, хотя постоянно говорит, что это курс о c++.

The information and overall learning experience was good. Easily 5 stars if it was updated to keep up with current Unreal Engine version (or at least not as old as 8 versions back). However, the content is out dated in many lectures. And there's loads potential bugs and errors. In fact in the last lecture He gets an error in the editor which he completely ignores and didn't even tell us what it was and how to fix it. In my case I use 4.26p with VS2019. I ended up with many errors on things like an Array error, or some classes don't even exist, warnings about debricated functions.. and few more. Luckily I know Blueprint so I tried to fix as much as I could but it would be great if the lecturer actually keeps this great course up to date.

Finally, I really would have loved this course if the lecturer actually communicate with us and answer our questions.

Overall, great course but be ready to fix a lot of problems yourself. So, rely too much on his methods as you'll find many things he does are outdated!

An iIncredible course covering a wide range of topics and helps you build the fundamentals of two common videogame genres: Stealth and Shooter.

He covers each subject in-depth and gives plenty of practical examples and opportunities for you to improve and apply what you have learnt.

By the end of the course you'll have two functional prototypes that you can expand on or even combine into a single game.

Tom provides a clear briefing prior to each section and provides clear understanding and enthusiasm in the lessons.

The instructor is very clear.

If you plan on using the most up to date engine, you will run into some issues. However, all of the QA's for each lecture have and up to date method.

Tom still replies to questions which is always a big help!

This is a great course for someone to learn how to make games with C++ and Unreal Engine. Tom is great at explaining things. I used version 4.24 and had to figure out somethings that have changed. The great part is you can check the Git repo and Tom has updated the code for 4.25 version.

Great course and I have learned so much. The EQS and advanced AI section was great.

instructor.name: Tom Looman
instructor.briefIntroduction:
Hi, my name is Tom. I'm a game developer who has worked with Unreal Engine 4 since day 1, both as an indie developer and as an engineer at Epic Games, the creators of Unreal Engine 4! Over the years I created 70+ tutorials and samples for the Unreal Engine community!

Through my courses I hope to teach you some of what I learned over the years and help you get started building your very own games! I enjoy explaining concepts by going hands-on and showing by example. I’m passionate about taking seemingly difficult concepts and boiling them down into simple to follow guides. My goal is to make game development approachable to anyone who is willing to learn.

Besides teaching and writing about games, I work on games every day, which keeps me up-to-date on Unreal Engine 4, C++, and the game creation process. I learn new things every day, which I then apply to my courses.

Join me on this game development adventure, and I hope to see you in one of my courses!
